snippet: A day after American officials said Turkey had agreed to allow the use of its air bases for operations against the Islamic State, Turkish officials said talks were still underway.
abstract: Turkish officials say there is no deal with United States to allow its air bases to be used for operations against Islamic State, one day after US officials announce deal; Turkish comments represent another miscommunication between US and Turkey.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, Eric Schmitt from Washington, and Ceylan Yeginsu from London.

lead_paragraph: A day after American officials said Turkey had agreed to allow the use of its air bases for operations against the Islamic State, Turkish officials said talks were still underway.

headline.main: Turkey Denies Reports of Deal for Use of Its Bases in Fight Against Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Turkey Denies Reports of Deal for Use of Its Bases in Fight Against Islamic State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
